title.narrative: OUTPUT 7.2: EXTERNAL RELATIONS AND COMMUNICATION

description.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided tools, guidance and resources for effective communication, resource mobilization and advocacy on child rights issues with stakeholders., which contributes to Policy, Guidance And Technical Support For Country Programming And Reporting, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country Programmes are efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided tools, guidance and resources for effective communication, resource mobilization andadvocacy on child rights issues with stakeholders.

description.narrative: SCO delivered 123;communication products and statements, highlighting the humanitarian situation and advocating for the protection of children in Syria. Engagement with audiences online and through traditional media outlets included photo and video packages, briefings for media, press releases and human-interest stories as well as newly introduced virtual field visits.;While needs across the country have increased, the HRP was significantly underfunded ($1.94 billion received against the $4.22 billion appeal – 46 per cent funded). Through sustained and concerted advocacy with donors, of the $232.4 million in requirements, $163.4 million was available (including carry-forward) – 70 per cent funding received. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2022

target.value: 2022:Total funding requirement for Syria CO of US $232.4 million at least 60 % funded (incl. carry forward)
